transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? This is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Do you have a quick minute to chat?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, yeah, I can spare a few. What’s this about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, I’ll be brief. I saw Acme Corp. recently wrapped up a data compliance review. I was curious if you’re exploring any changes to your database infrastructure off the back of that?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Um, we’re always looking at ways to be more compliant, but to be honest, we’re pretty invested in our MySQL setup. It’d take a lot to move away.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally get that, Zhi. Just to check—are scaling and compliance your main concerns right now? Or is there something else top of mind?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, I’d say those are the two biggest. Compliance is big for us, and also we’ve been hitting some load limits with MySQL during peak ad auctions.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That makes sense. Atlas was actually built for scenarios like high-speed bidding and bursty workloads. Out of curiosity, how are you handling sharding or scaling MySQL right now?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’ve got some homegrown sharding in place. It works, but it’s fragile and requires a lot of hands-on babysitting.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, I hear that a lot. With Atlas, sharding is handled automatically, no manual work—plus, you can scale up or down without downtime. On the compliance side, have you run into any headaches around audit trails or data residency yet?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’ve had to build some custom stuff, honestly. Audit trails, GDPR compliance, that kind of thing. But… isn’t MongoDB more expensive, though?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Fair question. The cost really depends on usage, but many adtech teams find they save on engineering hours and downtime. Can I ask—how much of your team’s time goes into maintaining MySQL each week?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly? Too much. But, uh, we’re also worried about being locked in—if we pick Atlas, is it hard to migrate away later if we need to?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s a great point. Atlas uses open standards and BSON, plus you can export your data at any time. It’s not a black box, so you’re not stuck. We also have migration pilots that minimize risk.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Alright, that’s good to know… But what about real-time performance? Like, can Atlas really handle billions of ad requests without choking?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. In fact, several top adtech platforms run on Atlas for exactly that reason. I can share some reference architectures and case studies if that’s helpful.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, send those over. But do you have anything focused on compliance for EU traffic? That’s a board-level priority for us right now.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Definitely, we offer regional data controls for GDPR, plus automated auditing and encryption at rest and in transit. I can loop in one of our compliance specialists if you’d like a deeper dive.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, that sounds worth a follow-up. Let’s set up a call next week with my team.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Perfect, I’ll send over some options. And I’ll include those case studies. Appreciate your time, Zhi!

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: No problem. Looking forward to your email, Arjun.
